Class ShoppingBag

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShoppingBag

  • public class ShoppingBag
extends java.lang.Object
    Shopping bag holds Grocery items desired by user while user is shopping. Grocery items are held in an array representing the bag and can be added and removed. The number of items in a Shopping Bag and the total price and tax of all the items in a Shopping Bag can also be retrieved.
    Author:
    Richard Wen, Elise Merritt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShoppingBag()
      Constructs a new Shopping Bag.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(GroceryItem item)
      Adds a Grocery Item to a shopping bag, increasing the capacity of the bag if needed.
      void empty()
      Completely empties the Shopping Bag.
      int getSize()
      Returns the number of Grocery Items currently in a Shopping Bag.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Tests the add(), remove(), grow(), salesTax() functions of the ShoppingBag class.

      Displays the Grocery Items contained in the Shopping Bag.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShoppingBag

        public ShoppingBag()
        Constructs a new Shopping Bag. The shopping bag is initially set to a built-in starting capacity and initially empty (size 0).

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the number of Grocery Items currently in a Shopping Bag.
        Returns:
        size of the shopping bag

      • add

        public void add(GroceryItem item)
        Adds a Grocery Item to a shopping bag, increasing the capacity of the bag if needed. The total number of items in the bag is updated automatically.
        Parameters:
        item - the Grocery Item to be added to the Shopping Bag

      • remove

        public boolean remove(GroceryItem item)
        Removes a Grocery Item from a Shopping Bag, if the item is in the bag. Item cannot be removed if it is not in the bag. The total number of items in the bag is updated automatically.
        Parameters:
        item - the Grocery Item to be removed from the Shopping Bag
        Returns:
        true if the item is successfully found and removed, false otherwise

      • salesPrice

        public double salesPrice()
        Calculates the total price of all Grocery Items in the Shopping Bag. Total price is the sum of the individual prices of each item in the bag. Total price of an empty bag is 0.
        Returns:
        total price of all Grocery Items in a Shopping Bag

      • salesTax

        public double salesTax()
        Calculates the total tax on all Grocery Items in the Shopping Bag. Total tax is the sum of the prices of all the taxable Grocery Items in a bag, multiplied by a set, unchangeable percentage.
        Returns:
        total tax on all Grocery Items in a Shopping Bag

      • print

        public void print()
        Displays the Grocery Items contained in the Shopping Bag. The name, price, and taxable status are printed for each Grocery Item in the bag.

      • empty

        public void empty()
        Completely empties the Shopping Bag. For use specifically when checking out the bag.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Tests the add(), remove(), grow(), salesTax() functions of the ShoppingBag class. Makes three ShoppingBag instances with several Grocery Items as test cases. See TestSpecification.doc for further details on test cases.
